snippet: In New Orleans and in Alabama on Tuesday, scores of newspaper employees walked into one-on-one meetings and walked out 10 minutes later with severance packages.
abstract: Four newspapers owned by Advance Publications lay off scores of employees; Times-Picayune in New Orleans lays off more than 200 people, and 400 in Alabama lose their jobs at three papers.

byline.contributor: David Carr contributed reporting from New York, and Kyle Whitmire from Birmingham, Ala.

lead_paragraph: In New Orleans and in Alabama on Tuesday, scores of newspaper employees walked into one-on-one meetings and walked out 10 minutes later with severance packages.

headline.main: New Orleans Struggles With Latest Storm, Newspaper Layoffs
headline.print_headline: New Orleans Struggles With Latest Storm, Newspaper Layoffs
